properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable this afternoon and evening for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-09-23T03:18:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-22T15:19:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1462587131.2019
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Ground temperatures will cool to near freezing over many regions of the Maritimes tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-22T16:54:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-22T00:55:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1363519066.2019

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southwesterly winds gusting to 80 km/h will develop this afternoon and will further increase to 100 km/h tonight. Winds are expected to diminish below warning criteria on Monday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-23T05:06:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-22T13:07:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2090507381.2019
Area: Northern Peninsula East
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A slow moving disturbance will continue to bring periods of rain to southern Manitoba tonight. Moderate to heavy rain redeveloped over southwestern Manitoba Saturday afternoon and is expected to gradually move to the northeast tonight. Early this evening satellite and weather radar indicated that the heavier precipitation associated with this system is taking a more northerly track. As a result portions of the northern Red River valley and the Bissett area will likely see lesser rainfall amounts and the rainfall warning has been ended for these regions. The rainfall warning remains in effect for portions of southwestern Manitoba and the southern Interlake with the rain tapering off this evening and overnight respectively. Total rainfall amounts in these areas from Thursday night to Sunday morning will likely range from 50 to 125 mm. . ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-22T15:42:33-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy precipitation expected later today and into Monday. Intermittent showers will continue today in parts of Central and Northeastern Ontario. However, a few rounds of heavier precipitation are expected to move in late this afternoon and continue into Monday. Total rainfall amounts in excess of 50 mm are possible. However, there is still some uncertainty in the track of this precipitation and the exact area that will receive heavier rainfall amounts. Rainfall warnings may be required. This situation will continue to be monitored closely. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-22T22:57:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-22T14:58:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3009911604.2019

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Conditions will be favourable for the development of patchy frost as ground temperatures near the freezing point overnight tonight, especially in inland and low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
